questions.question_text: Which of the following is an advanced distance vector routing protocol that automates routing tables and also uses some features of link-state routing protocols?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. EIGRP (Enhanced Interior Gateway Routing Protocol) is an advanced distance vector routing protocol that automates routing tables and also uses some features of link-state routing protocols. It is a Cisco proprietary protocol used in larger networks that require fast convergence and scalability.

RIP and EIGRP are Distance vector
BGP is Path vector
OSP and IS-IS is link state

comments.content:
RIP is considered distance vector
EIGRP and BGP are considered advanced distance vector

discussion.content:
1. Distance-vector routing protocols include RIP, RIPv2, and EIGRP. Of
these, RIPv2 would be the most popular from the examâ€™s perspective.
2. Link-state protocols include OSPF and IS-IS.

Selected Answer: D
Its D. BGP is a hybrid routing protocol.

comments.content:
Bro you need to 1.... Reead the question again. and 2. look up definitions. 
BGP might be a hybrid routing protocol but thats not what the question is asking. 
its C. EIGRP is an advanced vector routing protocol.
Both BGP and and EIGRP are advanced distance vector according to the Cengage Comptia Network+ textbook.
"and also uses some features of link-state routing protocols" ... only EIGPR qualifies for that.

questions.question_text: A network resource was accessed by an outsider as a result of a successful phishing campaign. Which of the following strategies should be employed to mitigate the effects of phishing?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
E. Don't be dumb.

Selected Answer: A
Multifactor Authentication is a system that would cause a phishing campaign to have to gather more information from multiple subjects, which would cause the attacker to come off as more conspicuous.

Selected Answer: A
Multifactor Authentication is a system that would cause a phishing campaign to have to gather more information from multiple subjects, which would cause the attacker come off as more conspicuous.

Selected Answer: B
B. Replacing the patch cable is the most likely solution to fix the issue of slow download speeds when accessing files on the network server. A faulty or damaged patch cable can cause packet loss and reduce the overall speed of the network connection, even if the NIC is capable of Gigabit Ethernet. Releasing and renewing the PC's IP address, reseating the NIC inside the PC, and flushing the DNS cache are unlikely to resolve the issue of slow download speeds on the network.

comments.content: Also its reseating not resetting I checked the options again
If the NIC card is too loose to begin with, it won't be able to connect at all, so I think the next feasible option would be "B"

discussion.content: Can somebody explain why it is not option C?

questions.question_text: A PC user who is on a local network reports very slow speeds when accessing files on the network server. The user's PC is connecting, but file downloads are very slow when compared to other users' download speeds. The PC's NIC should be capable of Gigabit Ethernet. Which of the following will MOST likely fix the issue?

choices.A: Releasing and renewing the PC's IP address
choices.C: Reseating the NIC inside the PC

questions.question_text: A network administrator is configuring logging on an edge switch. The requirements are to log each time a switch port goes up or down. Which of the following logging levels will provide this information?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Notifications

The logging level "Notifications" will provide the information about when a switch port goes up or down. This level logs important but non-critical events that occur on the switch, including port status changes. Warnings, errors, and alerts are higher levels of logging that may not provide the specific information required in this scenario.

Selected Answer: C
If this is about syslog severity levels, then I would go for C: alert (a fault requiring immidiate remediation). "Notification" is not one of these loffing levels.

comments.content: Check Topic 12C: Use Performance Metrics to Ensure Network Availability in CertMaster Learn for Network +. It says to use " ALERT " for it

whaaaaat??? yes notifications is a level dude. its not C. the correct answer is B
